thread.title: John Boehner replacement: What Boehner will tell Republicans at Friday meeting
thread.title_full: John Boehner replacement: What Boehner will tell Republicans at Friday meeting - POLITICO

author: Jake Sherman
title: John Boehner replacement: What Boehner will tell Republicans at Friday meeting
text:
Speaker John Boehner told House Republicans in a dramatic closed meeting Friday that they need to stick together and not draw firm lines on who they will vote for to replace him, according to a GOP source. The outgoing speaker received a standing ovation at the GOP conference gathering, which came a day after Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) abruptly dropped his bid for speaker. Boehner (R-Ohio) did not set a date Friday for the leadership election, sources said, but he still hopes to resign from Congress at the end of October as planned. However, Boehner has said – and reiterated Friday morning – that he will remain speaker until House Republicans settle on a replacement.
With House Republicans in a state of disarray after Thursday's whirlwind, Boehner, McCarthy and other top Republicans have made multiple appeals to Ways and Means Chairman Paul Ryan (R-Wis.) to run for the House’s top spot. Ryan is considering it, but people close to him say he remains very resistant to taking the post.
Ryan's Ways and Means Committee had a meeting scheduled Friday morning, but it was canceled, according to sources.
Reps. Jason Chaffetz of Utah and Daniel Webster of Florida are still candidates for speaker. GOP lawmakers are talking about a host of other Republicans for the post, including Reps. John Kline (Minn.), Lynn Westmoreland (Ga.), Tom Cole (Okla.) and Darrell Issa (Calif.).
